thread.title: Crowds turn out for royal gun salute marking 65 years of the Queen's reign | Wales
thread.title_full: Crowds turn out for royal gun salute marking 65 years of the Queen's reign | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Crowds turn out for royal gun salute marking 65 years of the Queen's reign | Wales
text:
Credit: ITV News A royal salute has been fired at Cardiff Castle to mark 65 years of the Queen's reign.
Her Majesty The Queen took the throne following the death of her father King George VI in 1952 and has made history as the first British monarch to reach their Sapphire Jubilee.
Credit: ITV News The Lord Lieutenant of Glamorgan took the salute as a Welsh military band led celebrations for the Queen's Sapphire Jubilee in Cardiff.
The Queen always spends Accession Day at Sandringham. As for her, it's a sombre moment in which she reflects on her father's death.
Watch Richard Morgan 's report:
